title: American Horror Story: Double Feature Episode 1 and 2 Review
author: Reel Talk
comment: Don’t forget, the natives to the town had “red lights” on before night fall. Their house was the only one who didn’t…that could be why the creatures went to their house.
My personal opinion is this seems like it’s gonna be an amazing season. We haven’t had something really good in a while so I’m excited

The reason Lark is able to take the pill isn’t because of her dentistry it’s because she’s a tattoo artist. I still think the black pill is dependent on a persons creativity not just any general talent.

The drug isn't really that broad, seeing as Lark is a tattoo artist as well and she mentioned that the drug causes people from all over the world coming to get her art tattooed on them. She also then mentions that the drug works for various types of creative and artistic people.

This review jumped to A LOT of conclusions from just two episodes.Personally, I see a good story here. The debut episodes do.a fine job of establishing the premise, making me care about the characters, and getting me interested enough to tune in next week. What else can you ask from a premiere?
description:
American Horror Story: Double Feature Episode 1 "Cape Fear" and 2 "Pale" Review. Honestly, I don't know if American Horror Stories (the AHS Spinoff) was just that bad or these episodes are just that good. Either way, this was a great start to a promising season. Not without its problems, but I'm happy at what we saw.
